ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Continuation of L1 Italian. Learn new tenses and more vocab.
Advanced my knowledge of the Italian language.
Further developed my skills in writing and speaking Italian. Learned more about Italian culture.
Basic grammar and vocabulary pertaining to the Italian language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: the professor was really nice and overall and sweet person.  She really tried to help students.  Weaknesses: this class moves TOO fast.  Im not exaggerating when I say we covered a unit in 3 days.  We also did not hear about the oral exam until the week it was happening.  Overall lovely professor but the class needs major restructuring and possibly a different textbook.
Very chill, relaxed course. Professor Egan is a kind woman and a good teacher.

Strengths: the class is fun and lighthearted. 
Weaknesses: at times I felt very confused and did not know the direction of the course. The assignments / what was expected of us was very unclear. It was a lot of memorization and less putting those skills into conversation practice.

Professoressa Egan was great at teaching the material and very kind. Also, the assignments, projects, and exercises helped to cultivate learning. The tests are pretty fair.

I guess the main weakness of the course was that it was a bit disorganized as it didn't strictly follow the course syllabus. It was hard to know how to prepare for class ahead of time because of this. Despite that, it was still a good class.

The introductory courses are paced way too fast. Unless you are a language whiz there is just no way to adequately practice and actually absorb this much material in this little time. Even the profs admitted that some topics were skimmed just because they had already written the syllabus and were rushing to keep up.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would only recommend this course if you can handle learning new languages at a fast pace.  I believe Italian is a beautiful language and with the right structure would be a pleasure to learn however I feel like for me this class was too fast paced.  Also if you can Cr/D this class because the grading was harsh to me.
Yes, would definitely recommend taking L2 Italian with Professor Egan!
I would say take italian, but maybe a different section.

I would because it was very interesting, and Professoressa Egan is a great teacher. Just be sure to continually go through content and have a solid base for Italian grammar. If you don't, it will make studying for the final harder.
Yes, the instructor was phenomenal and the department overall is great with expansive resources to facilitate learning.
